forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 9pm, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between 9pm and 10pm, then a chance of rain showers and patchy fog between 10pm and midnight, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers between midnight and 1am. Cloudy, with a low around 53. West wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 65. Northwest wind 7 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As evening falls over Boston, a soft veil of patchy fog begins to settle across the landscape, intertwining with the remnants of day. The air holds a certain coolness, hinting at the rainfall that dances on the horizon, teasing with just a 40% chance of light showers. The low temperature settles around a gentle 53 degrees, offering a quiet embrace for those daring enough to venture out. The west wind whispers through the trees at a comfortable pace, yet gusts may occasionally rise, carrying that chill with a playful insistence. With the clouds concealing the stars, the night feels cozy, almost intimate, as if the city is retreating gently into its own thoughts.

Looking ahead, tomorrow promises a more cheerful disposition, as the clouds part to reveal a partly sunny day, beckoning with highs around 65 degrees. This transformation brings an invitation to step outside and relish the fresh air, perhaps while enjoying a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or sipping coffee at a quiet café. Light layers will suit the mood—an easy sweater or jacket to guard against the morning chill as you embrace the uplifting energy of the day. While the rain may shy away, the remnants of the fog linger, allowing for reflections and tranquility amidst the urban buzz. Such moments are best enjoyed in splendid simplicity, organizing a pocket of time to appreciate the world as it unfolds.
